name: places/ChIJbxFp7AxZwokREzLWqjyJxFk
formattedAddress: 390 Asser Levy Place, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 390 Asser Levy Place, New York, NY 10010, USA

originalText.text: Very clean water. It is a 4 feet 0 inches  tall pool. The water is warm and you can come in with the stroller by buzzing the side door and leave the stroller inside. There are family changing rooms and many lockers and  showers. Even though the pool is next the fdr you don’t hear it that much. I think I felt the pollution. But I had a good time with my kids. Respect the NYC pool rules - Show your lockers key, wear rubber shoes, wear swimming suit  and wear no hat no electronics and everything should smooth . No floaties is hard for me. My 6 years old can only stand on tippy toes and I have the hold the other one. The lifeguards yeld at me for having my kids on the pool ladder. Even is there was no one else there. The people in the pool were nice and some women helped me out by holding one kid. Definitely challenging with no kiddie pool and 2 kids but very cool experience. Kids loved it.

originalText.text:
Pros: cheap and great facilities
Cons: many old dudes that stare at women and think you want to have a chat with them

I never feel safe/comfortable without a male friend when I go here as I had many unpleasant strangers approach me and interrupt me when working out

originalText.text:
A decent, if crowded, outdoor pool - if you can actually make it inside. I’ve been turned away multiple times, either because the pool is unexpectedly closed (contrary to advertised hours) or because I had a watch (no “electronics” allowed apparently). Some staff seem to go out of their way to find problems.

Locker rooms are a bit grimy but functional. You need to bring your own padlock, and you will be asked to demonstrate that you have a padlock for a locker upon entry - another bizarre rule.

originalText.text:
Supervisors have an attitude and lack customer service to enforce the rules to a new vistor. Very aggresive and hassing/bullying behavior.

Its a shame these kinds of individuals are in any sort of supervisory position.

Received different rules by staff and then supervisor came very aggressively to speak to me.

Disgusting behavior.

originalText.text: I usually love this pool but online it states the session is from 11-3 and by 2:45 the life guarding was literally yelling at people to get off the deck , telling me she had to eat her lunch meanwhile the break is from 3-4 not 2:45. Extremely aggressive and rude
